content: overboard materials g hook ww yarn i used caron simply soft brites in orange and white google eyes yarn needle let s start 6 single_crochet in ring rd1 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 single_crochet rd2 2 single_crochet in first single_crochet single_crochet in next around 18 single_crochet rd3 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 18 single_crochet rd4 2 single_crochet in first single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet around 24 single_crochet rd5 & 6 single_crochet in each single_crochet around rd7 decrease 1 single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet around 18 single_crochet rd8 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 18 single_crochet rd9 decrease 1 single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet around 12 single_crochet rd10 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 single_crochet rd11 decrease-single_crochet around 6 single_crochet now hold both sides together and single_crochet across both thicknesses 6 or 7 single_crochet with same color and hook chain 4 2 treble_crochet in same space 3 treble_crochet in each single_crochet across turn change color and switch to next size down hook chain 23 skip 1st chain 2-3 single_crochet in each chain down single_crochet in next treble_crochet chain 23 repeat to the end of treble_crochet-row finish off weave in ends i joined the yarn on both sides of the fish and chained like 15 or something and did the same thing as above for the two side fins/arms glue on eyeballs fishy is good to go *please note that i am writing this pattern based on looking at the picture the cat seems to have taken off with overboard and memory is what i have to work with pattern written by gnathalie2
